oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Honorable discharge papers for Pvt. Joseph W. Knox
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pvt. Joseph William Knox enlisted in Trenton, Tennessee on July 25, 1918. He was a 25-year-old farmer with black hair, brown eyes and a dark complexion who stood 5'9" at enlistment. He served in France in Co. E, 11th Inf. Regt. in the Meuse-Argonne offensive. Knox was discharged on July 31, 1919 at Camp Gordon, Georgia. Knox married Ruth Gladhill in 1923 and worked as a brick mason and ran a dry cleaners. He died in Dyer, Tennessee, December 20, 1965. [See also GWjack019-024, 500-516]
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
